item.title: Chapter01 - Reliable Scalable and Maintainable Applications
item.description: Whenever I read a book, I try to underline things and later try to convert into digital notes. It almost become two phase revision of the book. These notes are from Martin Kleppmann’s book: Designing Data-Intensive Applications. Disclaimers: These notes are not a substitute of the book. These notes are from my understanding of the topic and typed manually (Yes I prefer physical book over digital one) . There might be the case when I missed something.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Mahesh. I build web products and lead engineers. I’m an engineering manager, a software engineer and everything in between. I’ve been a professional software engineer since 2003 and building and managing high performing software engineering teams at the 3Pillar Global. I’m particularly interested in building and managing high performing software engineering teams, system designing, full stack development, distributed systems, learning new stuff and applying it while solving the problems

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
